item.title: Siemens Energy's Year-End Net Debt Should Be Well Received
item.description: Siemens Energy’s lower-than-expected net debt should be welcomed by the market, Citi said, adding there were significant proceeds from disposals, meaning that on a pro-forma basis the group could reach a net cash position.

item.title: Low Platinum Prices Show How Banking on Miners Could Threaten the Energy Transition
item.description: South Africa’s platinum-sector woes show how quickly fortunes can change in mining.

item.title: Siemens Energy Hit by Wind Business
item.description: Siemens Energy reported a net loss in the fourth quarter due to mounting challenges at its wind-turbine business, but said it expected a break-even at Siemens Gamesa in fiscal 2026.

item.title: U.K. Inflation Falls to Two-Year Low
item.description: The U.K.’s inflation rate cooled to 4.6% in October, coming in below expectations, helped by easing food and energy prices and lifting a little pressure on the Bank of England ahead of its final meeting of the year next month.

item.title: Greek Bond Underperformance Vs Italy Expected to Reverse After Auction
item.description: The announcement of Greece’s up to €200 million bond auction contributed to the underperformance of 10-year Greek bonds versus Italian peers, but this might reverse after the supply is off the table, Citi Research said.

item.title: Infineon Fourth Quarter Tops Forecasts
item.description: Infineon met its fiscal 2023 targets and proposed a higher dividend after beating expectations for net profit and revenue in the fourth quarter.

item.title: Alstom to Cut Workforce in Debt Reduction Plan
item.description: Alstom said it planned to cut around 1,500 positions as part of a cost-savings plan to reduce debt and boost profitability.

item.title: EU Drafts Rules to Cut Energy Sector Methane Emissions
item.description: The European Union has agreed on new rules aimed at cutting the amounts of methane emissions produced in the energy sector.

item.title: USD/SGD Likely to Fall in Coming Weeks and Months, Charts Show
item.description: USD/SGD is likely to fall in the weeks and months ahead, based on technical charts, UOB Global Economics & Markets Research said in a report.

item.title: China's Retail Spending Picks Up, as Housing Slump Deepens
item.description: Consumption is strengthening, but economists called for policy makers to do more to support the momentum.

item.title: Ukraine Seeks to Reignite Counteroffensive With Daring River Crossings
item.description: Ukrainian toeholds across the Dnipro River in the south are a rare bright spot amid glum military news in recent months.

item.title: North Korean Escapee Who Begged on the Streets Chases K-Pop Stardom
item.description: Music from the SB Boyz draws inspiration from hardships felt not in the Kim Jong Un regime but South Korea.

item.title: The $2 Trillion Interest Bill That's Hitting Governments
item.description: Rising debt-servicing costs are complicating plans in many countries for more military and climate spending.

item.title: House Speaker Mike Johnson endorsed Trump's presidential campaign, dismissing questions about the former president's false claims that the 2020 election was stolen.
item.description: House Speaker Mike Johnson endorsed Trump’s presidential campaign, dismissing questions about the former president’s false claims that the 2020 election was stolen.

item.title: Berkshire Hathaway eliminated its stakes in a handful of American blue chips, including General Motors and Johnson & Johnson while the stock market's rally sputtered in the third quarter.
item.description: Berkshire Hathaway eliminated its stakes in a handful of American blue chips, including General Motors and Johnson & Johnson while the stock market’s rally sputtered in the third quarter.

item.title: A majority of United Auto Workers members at several General Motors factories voted against a proposed labor agreement, jeopardizing a tentative contract that both union leaders and the carmaker have called historic.
item.description: A majority of United Auto Workers members at several General Motors factories voted against a proposed labor agreement, jeopardizing a tentative contract that both union leaders and the carmaker have called historic.

item.title: Toyota unveiled its new, redesigned Camry, which will only be available as a hybrid when it hits dealership lots in the spring.
item.description: Toyota unveiled its new, redesigned Camry, which will only be available as a hybrid when it hits dealership lots in the spring.

item.title: A U.S. stock rally accelerated at the release of the inflation data, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow rising 1.9%, 2.4% and 1.4%, respectively.
item.description: A U.S. stock rally accelerated at the release of the inflation data, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow rising 1.9%, 2.4% and 1.4%, respectively.

item.title: Texas lawmakers approved a bill to allow the state to begin arresting, jailing and in some cases deporting migrants who cross the U.S.-Mexico border illegally.
item.description: Texas lawmakers approved a bill to allow the state to begin arresting, jailing and in some cases deporting migrants who cross the U.S.-Mexico border illegally.

item.title: Japan's economy shrank for the first time in three quarters in the July-September period because of sluggish household and corporate spending.
item.description: Japan’s economy shrank for the first time in three quarters in the July-September period because of sluggish household and corporate spending.
